explanation: an older person, especially a woman, who stays with and takes care of a younger woman who is not married when she is in public
sentence: She asked me to go to the cinema with her and Andrew, I think as a sort of chaperone.
sentence_gap: She asked me to go to the cinema with her and Andrew, I think as a sort of _________.

explanation: formal; to catch or become ill with a disease
sentence: He contracted malaria while he was travelling.
sentence_gap: He __________ malaria while he was travelling.

explanation: to get money from someone in a way that is not honest
sentence: He diddled me! He said that there were six in a bag, but there were only five.
sentence_gap: He _______ me! He said that there were six in a bag, but there were only five.

explanation: to prevent something from happening by acting first
sentence: Try to anticipate what your child will do and forestall problems.
sentence_gap: Try to anticipate what your child will do and _________ problems.

sentence: They treat christmas as just another excuse for gluttony.
sentence_gap: They treat christmas as just another excuse for ________.

explanation: to cut a large piece out of wood, coal, rock, stone, or another hard material in a rough way
sentence: The monument was hewn out of the side of a mountain.
sentence_gap: The monument was ____ out of the side of a mountain.

explanation: old use; a lord or king
sentence: No man would break an oath to his liege.
sentence_gap: No man would break an oath to his _____.

explanation: a group of words or style of speaking used by a particular group of people
sentence: I couldn't understand their legal parlance.

explanation: the sound of a lot of things gently and repeatedly hitting a surface; fast, continuous talk, esp. that of an entertainer or someone trying to sell things
sentence: I find the patter of rain on the roof soothing. Philip’s clever patter kept his audience in a good mood.
sentence_gap: I find the ______ of rain on the roof soothing. Philip’s clever ______ kept his audience in a good mood.

explanation: a state of not being able to decide what to do about a situation in which you are involved
sentence: We're in a quandary over which school to send her to.
sentence_gap: We're in a ________ over which school to send her to.

sentence: Remedial action must be taken now.

explanation: unable to leave somewhere because of a problem such as not having any transport or money
sentence: He left me stranded in town with no car and no money for a bus.
sentence_gap: He left me ________ in town with no car and no money for a bus.

explanation: to try very hard to do something or to make something happen, especially for a long time or against difficulties
sentence: In her writing she strove for a balance between innovation and familiar prose forms.
sentence_gap: In her writing she ______ for a balance between innovation and familiar prose forms.

explanation: (of a building, room, etc.) warm in an unpleasant way and without enough fresh air
sentence: It gets very hot and stuffy in here in summer.
sentence_gap: It gets very hot and ______ in here in summer.

explanation: a stitch used to sew up a cut in a person's body
sentence: The syringe was removed, the skull opening sealed with dental cement, and the skin sutured.
sentence_gap: The syringe was removed, the skull opening sealed with dental cement, and the skin _______.
